snippet: The school, a joint venture between the university and a hospital network, would occupy a vacant campus in Clifton and Nutley, N.J., that previously housed the pharmaceutical giant Roche.
abstract: Officials in North Jersey communities of Nutley and Clifton hope private medical school that is product of joint venture between Seton Hall University and Hackensack University Health Network will anchor repopulation of corporate campuses vacated by pharmaceutical companies; exodus of pharmaceutical companies has left officials in state scrambling to find ways to make up for lost jobs.
lead_paragraph: The school, a joint venture between the university and a hospital network, would occupy a vacant campus in Clifton and Nutley, N.J., that previously housed the pharmaceutical giant Roche.

headline.main: New Jersey Officials See Hope for Jobs in Seton Hall’s Medical School Plan
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Officials Pin Hopes on Medical School to Replace Lost Jobs
